trans-unit.source: What is Azure File storage?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure File storage?

trans-unit.source: File storage offers shared storage for applications using the standard SMB 2.1 protocol.
trans-unit.target: File storage offers shared storage for applications using the standard SMB 2.1 protocol.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure virtual machines and cloud services can share file data across application components via mounted shares, and on-premises applications can access file data in a share via the File storage API.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure virtual machines and cloud services can share file data across application components via mounted shares, and on-premises applications can access file data in a share via the File storage API.

trans-unit.source: Applications running in Azure virtual machines or cloud services can mount a File storage share to access file data, just as a desktop application would mount a typical SMB share.
trans-unit.target: Applications running in Azure virtual machines or cloud services can mount a File storage share to access file data, just as a desktop application would mount a typical SMB share.

trans-unit.source: Any number of Azure virtual machines or roles can mount and access the File storage share simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: Any number of Azure virtual machines or roles can mount and access the File storage share simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: Since a File storage share is a standard SMB 2.1 file share, applications running in Azure can access data in the share via file I/O APIs.
trans-unit.target: Since a File storage share is a standard SMB 2.1 file share, applications running in Azure can access data in the share via file I/O APIs.

trans-unit.source: Developers can therefore leverage their existing code and skills to migrate existing applications.
trans-unit.target: Developers can therefore leverage their existing code and skills to migrate existing applications.

trans-unit.source: IT Pros can use PowerShell cmdlets to create, mount, and manage File storage shares as part of the administration of Azure applications.
trans-unit.target: IT Pros can use PowerShell cmdlets to create, mount, and manage File storage shares as part of the administration of Azure applications.

trans-unit.source: This guide will show examples of both.
trans-unit.target: This guide will show examples of both.

trans-unit.source: Common uses of File storage include:
trans-unit.target: Common uses of File storage include:

trans-unit.source: Migrating on-premises applications that rely on file shares to run on Azure virtual machines or cloud services, without expensive rewrites
trans-unit.target: Migrating on-premises applications that rely on file shares to run on Azure virtual machines or cloud services, without expensive rewrites

trans-unit.source: Storing shared application settings, for example in configuration files
trans-unit.target: Storing shared application settings, for example in configuration files

trans-unit.source: Storing diagnostic data such as logs, metrics, and crash dumps in a shared location
trans-unit.target: Storing diagnostic data such as logs, metrics, and crash dumps in a shared location

trans-unit.source: Storing tools and utilities needed for developing or administering Azure virtual machines or cloud services
trans-unit.target: Storing tools and utilities needed for developing or administering Azure virtual machines or cloud services

trans-unit.source: File storage concepts
trans-unit.target: File storage concepts

trans-unit.source: File storage contains the following components:
trans-unit.target: File storage contains the following components:

trans-unit.source: files-concepts
trans-unit.target: files-concepts

trans-unit.source: **Storage Account:** All access to Azure Storage is done
trans-unit.target: **Storage Account:** All access to Azure Storage is done

trans-unit.source: through a storage account.
trans-unit.target: through a storage account.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn249410.aspx) for details about storage account capacity.
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn249410.aspx) for details about storage account capacity.

trans-unit.source: **Share:** A File storage share is an SMB 2.1 file share in Azure.
trans-unit.target: **Share:** A File storage share is an SMB 2.1 file share in Azure.

trans-unit.source: All directories and files must be created in a parent share.
trans-unit.target: All directories and files must be created in a parent share.

trans-unit.source: An account can contain an
trans-unit.target: An account can contain an

trans-unit.source: unlimited number of shares, and a share can store an unlimited
trans-unit.target: unlimited number of shares, and a share can store an unlimited

trans-unit.source: number of files, up to the capacity limits of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: number of files, up to the capacity limits of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: **Directory:** An optional hierarchy of directories.
trans-unit.target: **Directory:** An optional hierarchy of directories.

trans-unit.source: **File:** A file in the share.
trans-unit.target: **File:** A file in the share.

trans-unit.source: A file may be up to 1 TB in size.
trans-unit.target: A file may be up to 1 TB in size.

trans-unit.source: **URL format:** Files are addressable using the following URL
trans-unit.target: **URL format:** Files are addressable using the following URL

trans-unit.source: format:
trans-unit.target: format:

trans-unit.source: https://`<storage account>`.file.core.windows.net/`<share>`/`<directory/directories>`/`<file>`
trans-unit.target: https://`<storage account>`.file.core.windows.net/`<share>`/`<directory/directories>`/`<file>`

trans-unit.source: The following example URL could be used to address one of the files in the
trans-unit.target: The following example URL could be used to address one of the files in the

trans-unit.source: For details about how to name shares, directories, and files, see [Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn167011.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For details about how to name shares, directories, and files, see [Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn167011.aspx).
